mlr3fselect v0.1.0-9000

FSelectEvolutionary Class

Source: R/FSelectEvolutionary.R
FSelectEvolutionary.Rd

Subclass for evolutionary feature selection. Calls ecr::ecr() from package ecr.

Dictionary

This FSelect can be instantiated via the dictionary mlr_fselectors or with the associated sugar function fs():

mlr_fselectors$get("evolutionary")
fs("evolutionary")

Parameters

mu

integer(1)

lambda

integer(1)

p.recomb

double(1)

p.mut

double(1)

survival.strategy

character(1)

n.elite

integer(1)

initial.solutions

list of integer()

parent.selector

ecr selector

survival.selector

ecr selector

For the meaning of the control parameter, see ecr::ecr(). Note that mu and lambda must be set by the user. The terminators parameter is replaced by the Terminator subclasses.

Super classes

bbotk::Optimizer -> mlr3fselect::FSelect -> FSelectEvolutionary

  • FSelectEvolutionary$new()

Method new()

Creates a new instance of this R6 class.

Usage

FSelectEvolutionary$new()

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

FSelectEvolutionary$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

library(mlr3)

terminator = term("evals", n_evals = 10)
instance = FSelectInstance$new(
  task = tsk("iris"),
  learner = lrn("classif.rpart"),
  resampling = rsmp("holdout"),
  measures = msr("classif.ce"),
  terminator = terminator
)

fs = fs("evolutionary", mu = 10, lambda = 5)
fs$optimize(instance)
instance$result
#> $feat
#> [1] "Petal.Width"
#> 
#> $perf
#> classif.ce 
#>       0.04 
#> 
instance$archive$data
